H0.text: where is a simple gear train used in real life. Bicycle Gears

H2.text: where is a simple gear train used in real life. Wind Turbines

H3.text: where is a simple gear train used in real life. Automobile drivetrains

A4.text: The speed ratios of chain and belt drives are computed in the same way as gear ratios. See bicycle gearing.

A5.text: The typical automobile manual transmission engages reverse gear by means of inserting a reverse idler between two gears.

A6.text: All the advertised speeds are available as distinct gear ratios controlled by a single shifter

A7.text: Hub gearing is often used for bicycles intended for city-riding and commuting.
